page.title: 17THE SOUTERAIN.
page.content: archaelogical expert thought it likely that a system of similar chambers lay underneath the 10 acre field.He said that Souterains were used for storing food,or as a refuge from enemies. The Souterains are a common feature in Co.Antrim,usually found with ring forts.Unlike those in Co.Down which are linear in shape,those in Co.Antrim have chambers going off at rt.angles. This Souterain which dates as far back as 800 A.D.is to be investigated by the Department of the Environment once the barley crop has been cut in August. Perhaps many more lie undiscovered beneath our countryside,awaiting some curious mind,the course of nature or simply _Time _to uncover our past for the future.
